markdownRemark.html:
This is the method I used to create this blog in just a few hours (the content took quite a bit longer). This will not be an in depth guide to using each of these sites and tools. I will link to good tutorials that can fill in any gaps I have here.

We will be relying on the free tier of products offered by Google Cloud

Things you need to get started

  • Domain Name (technically not free, but you can set your blog up on a sub-domain of an existing one like I did)
  • Cloudflare CDN account
  • Google Cloud account (if you don’t already have one they offer $300 in credit to open one - but we won’t be using that)
  • GitHub account
  • Node.js installed (with NPM)
  • (optional) Google Analytics account

Step 1: Scaffolding the Project

The first thing we are going to do is install the gatsby cli:

npm install -g gatsby-cli

Where ever you want your source code to live run:

# !!! replace [gatsby-blog] with whatever you want your project called
gatsby new [gatsby-blog] https://github.com/gatsbyjs/gatsby-starter-blog
cd [gatsby-blog]

After this runs you should have all the project structure you need to get started. Let’s test it to see how it looks.

gatsby develop

Open your browser to http://localhost:8000 and poke around.

Making the blog yours

empty repo on github.com. Google Cloud Build (one of the tools we will setup later) has integrations for Bitbucket as well, but I went with GitHub.
